Rare disease patients have complex clinical representations. Patients with Epileptic Encephalopathy, Early Infantile, 17 present clinical features that include epileptic seizures, developmental delay, motor and speech delay, and autism spectrum disorder. In addition, the patients may present with ataxia, hypotonia, dysmorphic features, and/or a distinctive facial appearance.
